member.summary: Gets column number (zero based) of the cell.

member.name: P:Aspose.Excel.Cell.Type
member.summary: Represents cell type.
member.remarks:
If a cell in designer file contains DateTime data, the cell type may be IsDateTime or IsNumeric.
If the number format is standard DateTime format, the cell type is IsDateTime. If the number format is custom format, the cell type is IsNumeric. You can use the Cell.Style.Custom property to get the custom number format string to determine if it is a DateTime value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Excel.Cell.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the cell.
member.remarks: A cell name includes its column letter and row number. For example, the name of a cell in row 0 and column 0 is A1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Excel.Cell.Formula
member.summary: Gets or sets a formula of the .
member.remarks:
A formula string always begins with an equal sign (=). User can set any formula in Excel designer file. Aspose.Excel will keep all the formulas. If user use this property to set a formula to a cell, major part of Excel built-in functions is supported. And more is coming.
Now Excel built-in functions supported by Aspose.Excel:
[A]
ABS, AND, AVERAGE
[C]
CEILING, COLUMN, COLUMNS, CONCATENATE, COUNT, COUNTA
[D]
DATE, DAVERAGE, DCOUNT, DCOUNTA, DAY, DGET, DMAX, DMIN, DPRODUCT, DSTDEV, DSTDEVP,
DSUM, DVAR, DVARP
[E]
EXP
[F]
FALSE, FLOOR, FV
[H]
HLOOKUP, HOUR
[I]
IF, INT, ISBLANK, ISNUMBER
[L]
LEN, LOOKUP
[M]
MAX, MEDIAN, MID, MIN, MINUTE, MOD, MONTH
[N]
NOT, NOW, NPV
[R]
REPLACE
[O]
OR
[P]
PMT, PV
[R]
ROUND, ROW, ROWS
[S]
SECOND, STDEV, STDEVP, SUBTOTAL, SUM, SUMIF
[T]
TIME, TODAY, TRUE
[V]
VALUE, VLOOKUP
[W]
WEEKDAY
[Y]
YEAR

member.name: M:Aspose.Excel.Cell.SetAddInFormula(System.String, System.String)
member.summary: Sets an Add-In formula to the cell.
member.remarks:
Add-In file should be placed in the directory or sub-directory of Excel Add-In library. For example, file name can be "Eurotool.xla" or "solver\solver.xla".
This method is only supported in Corporate or above edition.

member.name: P:Aspose.Excel.Cells.this
member.summary: Gets the element at the specified cell row index and column index.

example.code:
[C#]
Cells cells = excel.Worksheets[0].Cells; Cell cell = cells[0, 0]; //Gets the cell at "A1"
[Visual Basic]
Dim cells As Cells = excel.Worksheets(0).Cells Dim cell As Cell = cells(0,0) 'Gets the cell at "A1"

member.name: P:Aspose.Excel.Cells.this
member.summary: Gets the element at the specified cell name.
member.param: Cell name,including its column letter and row number, for example A5.

example.code:
[C#]
Cells cells = excel.Worksheets[0].Cells; Cell cell = cells["A1"]; //Gets the cell at "A1"
[Visual Basic]
Dim cells As Cells = excel.Worksheets(0).Cells Dim cell As Cell = cells("A1") 'Gets the cell at "A1"

member.name: P:Aspose.Excel.Chart.Rotation
member.summary: Represents the rotation of the 3-D chart view (the rotation of the plot area around the z-axis, in degrees).
member.remarks: The value of this property must be from 0 to 360, except for 3-D bar charts, where the value must be from 0 to 44. The default value is 20. Applies only to 3-D charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Excel.Chart.Elevation
member.summary: Represents the elevation of the 3-D chart view, in degrees.
member.remarks: The chart elevation is the height at which you view the chart, in degrees. The default is 15 for most chart types. The value of this property must be between -90 and 90, except for 3-D bar charts, where it must be between 0 and 44.

member.name: P:Aspose.Excel.Chart.DepthPercent
member.summary: Represents the depth of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 20 and 2000 percent).

member.name: M:Aspose.Excel.Excel.#ctor(System.IO.StreamReader, System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of a object for licensed Web applications.
member.remarks: Use this constructor when you use Al.exe to assemble the license file into your assembly.
member.example:
Please make sure to create licenseStream using UnicodeEncoding.UTF7:
[C#]
StreamReader licenseStream = new StreamReader(licenseFile, UnicodeEncoding.UTF7); Excel excel = new Excel(licenseStream, this);
[Visual Basic]
Dim licenseStream As StreamReader = New StreamReader(licenseFile,UnicodeEncoding.UTF7) Dim excel As Excel = New Excel(licenseStream, Me)
member.param: The page to request this object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Excel.Excel.ChangePalette(System.Drawing.Color, System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the palette for the spreadsheet in the specified index.

remarks.br: The palette has 56 entries, each represented by an RGB value. If you set a color which is not in the palette, it will not take effect. So if you want to set a custom color, please change the palette at first.

member.name: M:Aspose.Excel.Excel.CalculateFormula
member.summary: Calculates the result of formulas.
member.remarks:
This method is only supported in Enterprise edition.
Now Excel built-in functions supported in this method:
[A]
ABS, AVERAGE
[C]
CEILING, COLUMN, COLUMNS, CONCATENATE, COUNT, COUNTA
[D]
DATE
[I]
IF
[L]
LEN
[M]
MAX, MIN
[O]
OR
[R]
ROW, ROWS
[S]
SUM

member.name: P:Aspose.Excel.PageSetup.PrintTitleColumns
member.summary: Represents the columns that contain the cells to be repeated on the left side of each page.

example.code:
[C#]
cells.PageSetup.PrintTitleColumns = "$A:$A";
[Visula Basic]
cells.PageSetup.PrintTitleColumns = "$A:$A"

member.name: P:Aspose.Excel.PageSetup.PrintTitleRows
member.summary: Represents the rows that contain the cells to be repeated at the top of each page.

example.code:
[C#]
cells.PageSetup.PrintTitleRows = "$1:$1";
[Visula Basic]
cells.PageSetup.PrintTitleRows = "$1:$1"

member.name: T:Aspose.Excel.Protection
member.summary: Represents the various types of protection options available for a worksheet. Only used in ExcelXP and above version.

member.name: P:Aspose.Excel.Protection.IsDeletingColumnsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the deletion of columns is allowed on a protected worksheet.
member.remarks: The columns containing the cells to be deleted must be unlocked when the sheet is protected, and "Select unlocked cells" option must be enabled.

member.name: P:Aspose.Excel.Protection.IsDeletingRowsAllowed
member.summary: Represents if the deletion of rows is allowed on a protected worksheet.
member.remarks: The rows containing the cells to be deleted must be unlocked when the sheet is protected, and "Select unlocked cells" option must be enabled.
